election_record.label: Vermont 1801 Governor

candidate.name: Campbell
candidate.note: Listed in returns as Doctor Campbell.

overview.note: "In the afternoon, the Committee of Canvassers, reported the re-election of His Excellency, Isaac Tichenor, by a majority of 2060" votes. The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT). October 15, 1801.

The Federal Galaxy (Brattleboro, VT) reports total votes they can list so far for Isaac Tichenor at 2514, for Israel Smith at 3173 and scattering votes at 115, however those figures do not include returns from 74 of the towns in the counties of Addison, Bennington, Chittenden, Franklin, Rutland and Windham.

sub_unit.name: Addison
sub_unit.note: The Haswell's Vermont Gazette revived (Bennington, VT), September 21, and The Ploughman, September 21, report the "statement of Votes for Governor, according to our accounts received...by return from eight towns" there were 321 votes for Isaac Tichenor, 574 for Israel Smith, and 16 scattering votes and "Fourteen towns not returned" in Addison County.
The Federal Galaxy (Brattleboro, VT), September 21, lists the same vote figures as the other sources and that there were 14 towns for which they had no returns in Addison County.

sub_unit.name: Vergennes
sub_unit.note: The Vergennes Gazette and Vermont and New-York Advertiser (Vergennes, VT), September 3, notes that these totals include returns from both Vergennes and Waltham.

sub_unit.name: Bennington
sub_unit.note: The Haswell's Vermont Gazette revived (Bennington, VT), September 21, and The Ploughman, September 21, report that "by return from twelve towns," there were 491 votes for Isaac Tichenor, 1149 for Israel Smith, and 36 scattering votes and from "three towns no return" in Bennington County.
The Federal Galaxy (Brattleboro, VT), September 21, lists the same vote figures as the other sources and that there were 3 towns for which they had no returns in Bennington County.

sub_unit.name: Bennington
sub_unit.note: The Ploughman, September 7, The Argus, September 15, and The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 24, report 257 votes for Israel Smith.

sub_unit.name: Readsboro
sub_unit.note: The Federal Galaxy, September 14, reports 2 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Readsboro.

sub_unit.name: Rupert
sub_unit.note: The Haswell's Vermont Gazette revived (Bennington, VT), September 7, and the Federal Galaxy, September 14, list Israel Smith with 130 votes.

sub_unit.name: Woodford
sub_unit.note: The Federal Galaxy, September 14, reports 3 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Readsboro.

sub_unit.name: Peacham
sub_unit.note: The Argus and the Windsor Federal Gazette (Windsor, VT), both of September 15, do not list any votes for Israel Smith in Peacham.

sub_unit.name: Chittenden
sub_unit.note: The Haswell's Vermont Gazette revived (Bennington, VT), September 21, and The Ploughman, September 21, report that "by return from five towns," there were 309 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 152 for Israel Smith and from "seventeen towns no return" in Chittenden County.
The Federal Galaxy (Brattleboro, VT), September 21, lists the same vote figures as the other sources and that there were 17 towns for which they had no returns in Chittenden County.

sub_unit.name: Stowe
sub_unit.note: Town Records note that votes for governer were "lost by town clerk."

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: The Haswell's Vermont Gazette revived (Bennington, VT), September 21, and The Ploughman, September 21, report that "by return from six towns," there were 254 votes for Isaac Tichenor, 292 for Israel Smith, and 29 scattering votes and from "twelve towns no returns" in Franklin County.
The Federal Galaxy (Brattleboro, VT), September 21, lists the same vote figures as the other sources and that there were 12 towns for which they had no returns in Franklin County.

sub_unit.name: Rutland
sub_unit.note: The Haswell's Vermont Gazette revived (Bennington, VT), September 21, and The Ploughman, September 21, report that "by return from ten towns," there were 399 votes for Isaac Tichenor, 935 for Israel Smith, and 18 scattering votes and from "sixteen towns no return" in Rutland County.
The Federal Galaxy (Brattleboro, VT), September 21, lists the same vote figures as the other sources and that there were 16 towns for which they had no returns in Rutland County.

sub_unit.name: Windham
sub_unit.note: The Haswell's Vermont Gazette revived (Bennington, VT), September 21, and The Ploughman, September 21, report that "by return from eight towns," there were 740 votes for Isaac Tichenor, 71 for Israel Smith, and 16 scattering votes "Opposition majority, 653" in Windham County.

The Federal Galaxy (Brattleboro, VT), September 21, lists the same vote figures as the other sources except that there were 71 votes for Israel Smith and that there were 12 towns for which they had no returns in Windham County.

sub_unit.name: Halifax
sub_unit.note: The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 24, The Argus, September 15, and the Windsor Federal Gazette (Windsor, VT), September 15, report 90 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 28 for Israel Smith in Halifax
The Federal Galaxy (Brattleboro, VT) reports 30 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 28 for Israel Smith in Halifax.

sub_unit.name: Marlboro
sub_unit.note: The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 24, The Argus, September 15, the Federal Galaxy, September 7, and the Windsor Federal Gazette (Windsor, VT), September 14 and 15, do not report any votes for Israel Smith in Marlboro.

sub_unit.name: Putney
sub_unit.note: The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 24, The Argus, September 15, and the Windsor Federal Gazette (Windsor, VT), September 15, report 7 votes for Israel Smith in Putney.

sub_unit.name: Wilmington
sub_unit.note: The Argus, September 15, and the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 24, report 119 votes for Israel Smith in Wilmington.

sub_unit.name: Chester
sub_unit.note: The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 24, The Argus, September 15, and the Windsor Federal Gazette (Windsor, VT), September 15, report 33 votes for Israel Smith in Chester.

sub_unit.name: Royalton
sub_unit.note: The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 24, The Argus, September 15, and the Windsor Federal Gazette (Windsor, VT), September 15, report 132 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 4 for Israel Smith in Royalton.

sub_unit.name: Windsor
sub_unit.note: The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 24, The Argus, September 15, and the Windsor Federal Gazette (Windsor, VT), September 15, report 140 votes for Israel Smith in Windsor.
